B-> I noticed that you skipped a few serial numbers in the mifos.srt file, may I know why ? Can you please correct this ?

text:
I have also noticed that you have not included the "how to upload signatures" and "how to view notes" tutorials in the screen-cast. I believe that you may have skipped those parts to keep the screen-cast within 10 minutes, however if you could include them in the screen-cast, it would be really nice. 

In order to do that, you could record a separate screen-cast on "how to upload signatures" and "how to view notes" from the app built from source, and then you could join the two videos together.

Also, may I know the name of the software that you use to edit videos ?

Other than that, good work. I am really impressed by your creativity : )
task_definition_name: Create a screencast to demonstrate the use of Android Field Officer App

text:
There is also an error at 9:29 in the video, you forgot to add the word "use" in the sentence. The sentence should read "How to use Path Tracker" and not "How to Path Tracker".

Also could you please remove the falling snow flakes from the video. I have noticed that an audio file is also present in the screen-cast. Is the audio file licensed under any of the open source licenses (in other words, is it free for anyone to use) ? If so, can you please attach the license ? And if not, then we may have copyright issues, and I would strongly advise you to remove the audio clip from the screen-cast.

If you want to add an audio file to the screen-cast I would recommend you to visit the below mentioned site which contains a directory of websites that host open source music. 

https://creativecommons.org/about/program-areas/arts-culture/arts-culture-resources/legalmusicforvideos/

text:
Hello Shivam, 

Amazing work ! But you made a few errors, can you please rectify them. The mifos.srt file that you attached contains a few errors; please make the following changes as mentioned below.

Can you please replace the phrase "Click on" with "Tap on" as we are running the app on a touch screen device. It would make more sense to have "Top on" instead of "Click on". And also can you replace "three dots" with "Pop Up menu (three  dots)" in the .srt file.    

I have illustrated a few examples below (the numbers correspond to the serial numbers present in the mifos.srt file) - 

3 -> To Logout, tap on the Pop-up Menu (three dots) located at the top right corner and then tap on Logout  
4-> Tap on the Spinner (drop down menu)
5-> Then tap on clients
7-> Tap on any client to view their account details
9-> Tap on the Spinner (drop down menu) again
10-> Tap on Groups
11-> Then tap on a Group 
13-> To create a client, tap on the Pop Up menu (three dots) and select "Create Client"

->
task_definition_name: Create a screencast to demonstrate the use of Android Field Officer App

text: Done!

text:
Hello Shivam,

Please follow these steps to view Notes of a client - 

1-> Tap on the Hamburger Menu (three horizontal bars) button and then select Clients 
2-> Select a client from the list of clients. 
3-> Tap on the PopUp menu on the top right (three dots) and then select "Notes" 

Please follow these steps to upload a signature -

1-> Tap on the Hamburger Menu (three horizontal bars) button and then select Clients 
2-> Select a client from the list of clients. 
3-> Tap on the PopUp menu on the top right (three dots) and then select "Upload Signature"

Also, I hope that you have built the android app from source, available in the GitHub repository; as the app present in Google Play Store currently doesn't have all the latest additions made to the app. 

If you need any help, please let me know, I'll be glad to assist you.  :)
task_definition_name: Create a screencast to demonstrate the use of Android Field Officer App

text: How to view notes as well as upload signature?

text:
I was reading through my comment in regard to your query, and I realized that I made a few errors. 

The Hamburger Menu is a made of three horizontal lines and not vertical lines. Apart from that, the Floating Action Button is located on the bottom right and not on the bottom left as erroneously mentioned in my comment.  

My apologies for the inconsistencies. 

If you need any help, please let me know, I'll be glad to assist you.  :)
task_definition_name: Create a screencast to demonstrate the use of Android Field Officer App

text: Thanks for helping me :)
task_definition_name: Create a screencast to demonstrate the use of Android Field Officer App

text:
Hello Shivam,

Please follow these steps to add a client to a group - 

1-> Tap on the Hamberger Menu (three vertical bars) button and then select Groups
2-> Select a group from the ListView 
3-> Tap on the PopUp menu on the top right (three dots) and then select "Group Clients" 
4-> Then tap on the Floating Action Button (button with the plus symbol) on the bottom left.

You should now be able to create and add a client to the group.

And then regarding the 4th point, you have show the following in the screen-cast - 

1-> How to add Charges
2-> How to add Savings Account
3-> How to add a Loan Account
4-> How to upload, download, update and remove a Document
5-> How to upload a Signature
6-> How to add and remove Identifiers
7-> How to fill out a Survey
8-> How to view Notes 

All of the above can be done by selecting a client and then tapping on the PopUp Menu (three dots) on the top right.

If you require any further assistance please let me know, I'll be glad to help.

Good luck :)
